nostalgic.text: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
nostalgic.author: John Banville

nostalgic.text: Nostalgia is a dirty liar that insists things were better than they seemed.
nostalgic.author: Michelle K.

nostalgic.text: Sometimes you will never know the true value of a moment until it becomes a memory.
nostalgic.author: Dr. Seuss

nostalgic.text: Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart.
nostalgic.author: Haruki Murakami

nostalgic.text: To reminisce is to recall with joy and tenderness what we have known and loved.
nostalgic.author: Unknown

cosy.text: There is nothing cozier than a home filled with love.
cosy.author: Anonymous

cosy.text: Home is the nicest word there is.
cosy.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

cosy.text: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
cosy.author: Jane Austen

cosy.text: A house is made of walls and beams; a home is built with love and dreams.
cosy.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

cosy.text: There's nothing like a good cup of tea to make a day cosy.
cosy.author: Unknown

focus.text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
focus.author: Bruce Lee

focus.text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
focus.author: Alexander Graham Bell

focus.text: Focus on the journey, not the destination.
focus.author: Greg Anderson

focus.text: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
focus.author: Tim Ferriss

energetic.text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
energetic.author: Benjamin Franklin

energetic.text: The energy you give, the energy you receive.
energetic.author: Anonymous

energetic.text: Stay positive, work hard, make it happen.
energetic.author: Anonymous

energetic.text: High energy is contagious; surround yourself with it.
energetic.author: Anonymous

inspirational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
inspirational.author: Peter Drucker

inspirational.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

inspirational.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
inspirational.author: Dalai Lama

relaxed.text: Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.
relaxed.author: Mark Black

relaxed.text: Calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence.
relaxed.author: Dalai Lama

relaxed.text: Relaxation means releasing all concern and tension and letting the natural order of life flow through one's being.
relaxed.author: Donald Curtis

relaxed.text: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
relaxed.author: Deepak Chopra

relaxed.text: The time to relax is when you don't have time for it.
relaxed.author: Sydney J. Harris

grateful.text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
grateful.author: Aesop

grateful.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.
grateful.author: Cicero

grateful.text: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
grateful.author: William Arthur Ward

grateful.text: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
grateful.author: William Arthur Ward

grateful.text: Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies.
grateful.author: John Milton
